result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis J Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268 paid in full from bond.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with BZ.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Bethany Z. or her known residence.
- Defendant shall not be on any University of Wisconsin Madison property.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- The Court finds sustantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur.  The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
 - The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $500.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.   If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
